description: From Yiddish קוועטשן‎ (kvetshn, literally “to squeeze, pinch”), from Middle High German quetschen (“crush, press”).

entries.meaning: A person who endlessly whines or complains; a person who finds fault with anything.
An instance of kvetching; a complaint or whine.

verbs.description: kvetch (third-person singular simple present kvetches, present participle kvetching, simple past and past participle kvetched)

entries.meaning: To whine or complain, often needlessly and incessantly.
